def_en: If you take something back, you return it to the place where you bought it or where you borrowed it from, because it is unsuitable or broken, or because you have finished with it.

def_cn: 收回，撤回(所说的话或想法)
def_en: If you take something back, you admit that something that you said or thought is wrong.
If you take someone back, you allow them to come home again, after they have gone away because of a quarrel or other problem.
If you say that something takes you back, you mean that it reminds you of a period of your past life and makes you think about it again.
